quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Vibes and Ryan Gosling
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This German-born cellist came to the USA to play with the Metropolitan Opera and then began writing his own operettas. He wrote The Naughty Marietta in 1910.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Victor Herbet

questions.question: Ryan Gosling was part of the notorious crew of the Micky Mouse Club.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This great tenor sax player was usually photographed wearing a pork-pie hat. His signature song was Body and Soul.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coleman Hawkins

questions.question: This Prussian-born musician/impresario began as a cigar manufacturer. In 1899 he built his first music venue in New York City. It was the first of many. He, his sons and grandsons formed a dynasty that was very influential in American entertainment.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oscar Hammerstein

questions.question: What do the following people have in common: Duke Ellington, Ira Gershwin, Vernon and Irene Castle, George M. Cohan, Celia Cruz, Miles Davis, Oscar Hammerstein, Lionel Hampton, W.C.Handy,  Coleman Hawkins, Victor Herbet, Milt Jackson, Illinois Jacquet, Canada Lee, Harold Nichols?

options.text: They all were called at the McCarthy hearings.
They were all given the Presidential Medal of Freedom.
They are all in The Bronx, New York.
They all performed in the Kenndedy center in Washington, D.C.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They are all in The Bronx, New York.

questions.question: He was an important part of the quartet that integrated jazz. He played the vibes and the drums with several groups.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lionel Hampton

questions.question: Yes, there are many great tap dancers but when tap dancers talk about the greatest  they always mention this dancer and his brother, Fayard.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harold Nichols

questions.question: He was a great tenor sax  player whose best work was with the Cab Calloway Orchestra. He played a famous solo in the movie Stormy Weather that featured Lena Horne. Although his first name was Jean Baptiste, he  preferred his middle name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Illinois Jacquet

questions.question: He was a fine movie actor who had significant roles in Cry, the Beloved Country and Lifeboat. He was  also a civil rights leader in the 1930s and 1940s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Canada Lee

questions.question: He played vibes for the Modern Jazz Quartet.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Milt Jackson

questions.question: The main character in the film The Believer, played by Ryan Gosling, belongs to what group?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Neo-Nazis

questions.question: This trumpeter was one of the leaders of the Bebop jazz genre. Bitches Brew  and Sketches of Spain were his most famous albums. He won 9 Grammys and countless other awards.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Miles Davis

questions.question: This actor/singer/dancer/choreographer/impresario/musician was the most talented part of a family act in vaudeville. Although he and his family claimed he was Born on the Fourth of July his birthday was July 3. He wrote more than 50 Broadway musicals. James Cagney portrayed him in a famous biopic.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George M. Cohan

questions.question: This entertainer is generally considered the most influential female singer in Cuban music. She was born in Havana in 1925 and was famous for her hit  albums with Tito Puente.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Celia Cruz

questions.question: He was called The Father of the Blues and was famous for playing on Beale Street in Memphis, Tennessee.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: W.C.Handy

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Lloyd Bridges and Movie
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, seinfeld, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Monkey on my Back is a song from this Aerosmith album that won Grammys and MTV Music Awards.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pump

questions.question: What is the title of the Aerosmith album which included the timeless hit, Dream On?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aerosmith

questions.question: Which statement is true about the 1949 movie Home of the Brave, starring Lloyd Bridges?

options.text: It centered on a group of soldiers during  the Korean conflict.
It was about the physical effects war can have on soldiers.
It was about a team of Marines assigned to defend the Philippines during WWII.
It starred Gregory Peck and Richard Boone.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It centered on a group of soldiers during  the Korean conflict.

questions.question: The single, Walking the Dog, was originally recorded by which of the following artists?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rufus Thomas

questions.question: Lloyd Bridges appeared in two episodes of Seinfeld. What two jobs did his character have on the show?

options.text: trainer and owner of a crepe restaurant
owner of a used car lot and a trainer
owner of a used car lot and the manager of a condo in Florida

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: trainer and owner of a crepe restaurant

questions.question: Steven Tyler, Joe Perry, Brad Whitford, Tom Hamilton, and Joey Kramer have been the main members of Aerosmith for over 30 years. However, at times, certain band-members would take time away, and other musicians would fill in the gap. The other 3 musicians who played in the band are, Ray Tabano, Rick Dufay, and who else?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jimmy Crespo

questions.question: This series, that ran on CBS from 1958-1961, was one of Lloyd Bridges biggest TV hits.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sea Hunt

questions.question: In 1914, when he was one year old, Lloyd Bridges won a Fat Baby contest. The man who gave him the  prize is known as the most obese American President. Who is he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: W.H. Taft

questions.question: Born Stephen Tallarico on March 26, 1948, Steven Tyler is the frontman for the Bad Boys of Boston, Aerosmith. Where was Steven born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yonkers, NY

questions.question: Lloyd Bridges, Beau Bridges, Jeff Bridges and Cindy Bridges all appeared on the TV show Sea Hunt.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Known for their excessive drug use in the early years, Steven Tyler and Joe Perry at one time were branded with what unflattering nickname?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Toxic Twins

questions.question: This movie, starring Lloyd Bridges, Humphrey Bogart and Rex Ingram, is about an allied tank crew that captures a German battalion in WWII.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sahara

questions.question: In what year was Lloyd Bridges first movie, Freshman Love, released?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1936

questions.question: After becoming clean, Aerosmith started recording album after album. The sound became crisp, clean, and hard. The tours were amazing. Steven was a one-man-wrecking ball. They experienced an unheard-of success. So much so that on February 21, 1990, they were invited to appear and perform on Saturday Night Live, where they blew the roof off the joint. What skit, which later became a movie, did they appear in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Waynes World

questions.question: In 1945 Lloyd Bridges starred in a WWII movie about an American infantry platoon assigned to take over an Italian building. What is the name of this movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Walk in the Sun

questions.question: In 1998 William H. Macy participated in a John Travolta movie. What was the movie about?

options.text: A law suit against the government agency that was supposed to protect the public.
A rogue Navy SEAL that steal several nuclear warheads and wants to sell them to the highest bidder.
A mobster that is able to switch his face with that of another person.
A law suit against a firm that dumped hazardous waste.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A law suit against a firm that dumped hazardous waste.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: At birth

questions.question: Which statement about Emmy-winning American actor William H. Macy is true?

options.text: He played in The Lost World: Jurassic Park
He had a role in the first Jurassic Park movie.
He was in Jurassic Park III.
He was never in a Jurassic Park movie.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was in Jurassic Park III.

questions.question: Which statement about Don Cheadle is true?

options.text: Don Cheadle was born 11/29/1964 in Kaknsas City, Mo., went  to High School in Colorado and graduated  the California Institute of the Arts.
Don Cheadle was born 11/29/1974 in Los Angeles, CA., went  to High School in Phoenix, and graduated from UCLA.

Don Cheadle was born 11/29/1972 in Houston, TX., went to High School in Galveston, and graduated from Northwestern University.
